title: How to Make Jam Thumbprint Cookies

steps.headline: Sift the flour.
steps.description: Sieve the self-raising flour into a large bowl.

steps.headline: Add the butter or margarine.
steps.description: Get your butter or margarine and break it up into pieces. Mix the it into the flour until it is a bread crumb consistency.

steps.headline: Add the sugar.
steps.description: Add half of the sugar in, while mixing the ingredients with your hands, then once that has mixed in, add the other half of sugar and continue to mix.

steps.headline: Beat the egg.
steps.description: Beat the egg with a whisk in a separate jug or container, then pour in half of the beaten egg into the mixture while mixing into mixture with hand.

steps.headline: Start making the dough.
steps.description: Add the second half of the beaten egg in to start making the dough. Don't overmix, otherwise the dough will become too sticky.

steps.headline: Roll you dough.
steps.description: When you have your dough, roll it out into a sausage shape, then slice up into 9-10 pieces.

steps.headline: Lay your cookies on a baking sheet.
steps.description: Lay out the pieces on a greased baking tray, but space them out so there is enough room for the cookies to spread out.

steps.headline: Add the jam.
steps.description: In each cookie, press your thumb in to make a small circular shape, then pour your flavored jam into each circular dent.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies.
steps.description: Place your thumbprint cookies into the oven and have it bake for 10-15 minutes, until they are golden brown.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Transfer onto a cooling rack and leave to cool for 10 minutes, then enjoy your yummy thumbprint cookies!

text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Sift the flour. Sieve the self-raising flour into a large bowl. Add the butter or margarine. Get your butter or margarine and break it up into pieces. Mix the it into the flour until it is a bread crumb consistency. Add the sugar. Add half of the sugar in, while mixing the ingredients with your hands, then once that has mixed in, add the other half of sugar and continue to mix. Beat the egg. Beat the egg with a whisk in a separate jug or container, then pour in half of the beaten egg into the mixture while mixing into mixture with hand. Start making the dough. Add the second half of the beaten egg in to start making the dough. Don't overmix, otherwise the dough will become too sticky. Roll you dough. When you have your dough, roll it out into a sausage shape, then slice up into 9-10 pieces. Lay your cookies on a baking sheet. Lay out the pieces on a greased baking tray, but space them out so there is enough room for the cookies to spread out. Add the jam. In each cookie, press your thumb in to make a small circular shape, then pour your flavored jam into each circular dent. Bake the cookies. Place your thumbprint cookies into the oven and have it bake for 10-15 minutes, until they are golden brown. Serve. Transfer onto a cooling rack and leave to cool for 10 minutes, then enjoy your yummy thumbprint cookies!
